page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: {ROTHIEMURCHUS ESTATE}Boundary was established around 1560 and covers 25000 acres of mountainous moorland and woodland,with only 2000 acres of flat land suitable for mixed farming. The land is owned and managed by Mr John Grant and has been in the Grant family since the 16th Century.There are{four major types of land use}on the estate.{1) FARMING}The three Home Farms are Dell Farm,Doune Farm and Guislich Farm.These farms cover 750 acres of the total area,with the Tenant Farms of Achnahatnich and both Upper and Lower Tullochgrue covering a further 1250 acres.{Arable }Most of the area is conserved as winter feed for the suckler cows.About half is cropped as silage,some hay is made and the rest is barley.Some barley is grown specifically for the Spey Valley Whisky distilleries.
